item.title: Added support for Azure Monitor log search alert rules in Resource Health
item.description: Azure Resource Health helps you diagnose and get support for service problems that affect your Azure resources. Azure Resource Health now supports log search alert rules, so that you can use the activity log to check the health status of your log search alert rules.
item.atom:content: Azure Resource Health helps you diagnose and get support for service problems that affect your Azure resources. Azure Resource Health now supports log search alert rules, so that you can use the activity log to check the health status of your log search alert rules.

item.title: Log search alert rules using linked storage will require using a managed identity staring July 2024
item.description: Starting July 2024, alert rules using linked storage will require a managed identity to access the linked storage. This requirement will be enforced on alert rules created with API version 2023-12-01 or newer. Creating or updating linked storage rules using an older API version will be blocked.
item.atom:content: Starting July 2024, alert rules using linked storage will require a managed identity to access the linked storage. This requirement will be enforced on alert rules created with API version 2023-12-01 or newer. Creating or updating linked storage rules using an older API version will be blocked.

item.title: General Availability: Audit logging in Azure API Management developer portal
item.description: We are excited to announce that audit logging for user actions in the Azure API Management developer portal is now generally available. API administrators and managers can now enable a diagnostic setting in Azure API Management to send developer portal audit logs to a storage account, event hub, or Log Analytics workspace.
item.atom:content: We are excited to announce that audit logging for user actions in the Azure API Management developer portal is now generally available. API administrators and managers can now enable a diagnostic setting in Azure API Management to send developer portal audit logs to a storage account, event hub, or Log Analytics workspace.

item.title: We’re retiring Azure Time Series Insights on 7 July 2024 – transition to Azure Data Explorer
item.description: We’ll retire Azure Time Series Insights on 7 July 2024.
item.atom:content: We’ll retire Azure Time Series Insights on 7 July 2024.

item.title: Public Preview: Analyze data using Log Analytics Simple mode
item.description: Azure Monitor Logs is excited to introduce the next leap in log experience: Simple mode. Simple Mode allows users to utilize Azure Monitor Logs in a simple, point-and-click experience, eliminating the need for KQL for most common use cases.
item.atom:content: Azure Monitor Logs is excited to introduce the next leap in log experience: Simple mode. Simple Mode allows users to utilize Azure Monitor Logs in a simple, point-and-click experience, eliminating the need for KQL for most common use cases.

item.category: Azure Monitor; Action Groups; Feature; Services
item.title: Feature Update: Azure Action Groups
item.description: Customers using action groups with the notification type Email Resource Manager Role may see that different or more users are getting emails than were previously.
item.atom:content: Customers using action groups with the notification type Email Resource Manager Role may see that different or more users are getting emails than were previously.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Load Balancer now supports Admin State
item.description: Override Azure Load Balancer’s health probe behavior on a per backend pool instance basis using the new Load Balancer Admin State feature to make taking your VM out of rotation for maintenance easy.
item.atom:content: Override Azure Load Balancer’s health probe behavior on a per backend pool instance basis using the new Load Balancer Admin State feature to make taking your VM out of rotation for maintenance easy.

item.title: Public preview: Azure NetApp Files support for Active Directory connection per NetApp account
item.description: Azure NetApp Files support for one Active Directory connection per NetApp account now enables connecting a NetApp account to its own distinct Active Directory Forest and Domain. Azure NetApp Files can now be used with more than one Active Directory Forest and Domain in a region under a subscription.
item.atom:content: Azure NetApp Files support for one Active Directory connection per NetApp account now enables connecting a NetApp account to its own distinct Active Directory Forest and Domain. Azure NetApp Files can now be used with more than one Active Directory Forest and Domain in a region under a subscription.

item.title: Azure Virtual Network Manager’s virtual network verifier is now in public preview
item.description: Azure Virtual Network Manager’s virtual network verifier feature is now in public preview, enabling you to check if your network policies allow or disallow traffic between your Azure network resources.
item.atom:content: Azure Virtual Network Manager’s virtual network verifier feature is now in public preview, enabling you to check if your network policies allow or disallow traffic between your Azure network resources.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Bastion Premium
item.description: Azure Bastion Premium SKU secures customers’ highly sensitive workloads with advanced monitoring and security features
item.atom:content: Azure Bastion Premium SKU secures customers’ highly sensitive workloads with advanced monitoring and security features

item.title: Public Preview: Kubernetes Metadata and Logs Filtering in Azure Monitor - Container Insights
item.description: Kubernetes Metadata and Logs Filtering is now in Public Preview. Gain richer context and improved visibility into their workloads!
item.atom:content: Kubernetes Metadata and Logs Filtering is now in Public Preview. Gain richer context and improved visibility into their workloads!

item.title: General Availability: Azure NetApp Files backup
item.description: Azure NetApp Files backup expands the data protection capabilities of Azure NetApp Files by providing fully managed backup solution for long-term snapshot archive, recovery, and compliance.
item.atom:content: Azure NetApp Files backup expands the data protection capabilities of Azure NetApp Files by providing fully managed backup solution for long-term snapshot archive, recovery, and compliance.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Load Balancer health event logs
item.description: Azure Load Balancer now supports health event logs to help you identify and troubleshoot ongoing issues affecting your load balancer resource’s health.
item.atom:content: Azure Load Balancer now supports health event logs to help you identify and troubleshoot ongoing issues affecting your load balancer resource’s health.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Chaos Studio supports a new Pause Process fault for Windows virtual machines
item.description: Azure Chaos Studio supports a new Pause Process fault for Windows virtual machines.
item.atom:content: Azure Chaos Studio supports a new Pause Process fault for Windows virtual machines.

item.title: Public preview: Advanced Container Networking Services for Azure Kubernetes Services (AKS)
item.description: Advanced Container Networking Services for Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) is a suite of services that tackles observability, security, and compliance challenges in your containerized applications. Gain deep insights with Advanced Network Observability, our first feature of the suite that unlocks Hubble metrics, CLI, and UI for powerful traffic monitoring and performance optimization.
item.atom:content: Advanced Container Networking Services for Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) is a suite of services that tackles observability, security, and compliance challenges in your containerized applications. Gain deep insights with Advanced Network Observability, our first feature of the suite that unlocks Hubble metrics, CLI, and UI for powerful traffic monitoring and performance optimization.

item.title: General availability: Azure NetApp Files support for large volumes up to 500TiB in size
item.description: You can now create Azure NetApp Files large volumes between 50TiB to 500TiB in size.
item.atom:content: You can now create Azure NetApp Files large volumes between 50TiB to 500TiB in size.

item.title: General availability: Activity log alerts can now run in EU Data Boundary
item.description: Activity log alert rules can now be saved in European regions, ensuring the alert metadata and processing remains within EU Data Boundary.
item.atom:content: Activity log alert rules can now be saved in European regions, ensuring the alert metadata and processing remains within EU Data Boundary.

item.title: General Availability: VM Hibernation for General Purpose VMs
item.description: Hibernate VMs when not in use to save compute costs, while persisting the in-memory state.
item.atom:content: Hibernate VMs when not in use to save compute costs, while persisting the in-memory state.

item.title: General Availability: Azure API Center Extension for VS Code
item.description: The Azure API Center extension for Visual Studio Code is now generally available. You can use this extension to build, discover, try, and consume APIs in your API center.
item.atom:content: The Azure API Center extension for Visual Studio Code is now generally available. You can use this extension to build, discover, try, and consume APIs in your API center.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure HDInsight on AKS is now available for preview in 6 new regions
item.description: Azure HDInsight on AKS is a modern, reliable, secure, and fully managed Platform as a Service (PaaS) that runs on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS). HDInsight on AKS allows you to deploy popular Open-Source Analytics workloads like Apache Spark™, Apache Flink®️, and Trino without the overhead of managing and monitoring containers. For more information about Azure HDInsight on AKS, see the documentation
item.atom:content: Azure HDInsight on AKS is a modern, reliable, secure, and fully managed Platform as a Service (PaaS) that runs on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS). HDInsight on AKS allows you to deploy popular Open-Source Analytics workloads like Apache Spark™, Apache Flink®️, and Trino without the overhead of managing and monitoring containers. For more information about Azure HDInsight on AKS, see the documentation

item.title: Visual Studio Code extension for Azure Web PubSub now in preview
item.description: New option helps developers manage Web PubSub resources
item.atom:content: New option helps developers manage Web PubSub resources

item.title: Public preview: Azure NetApp Files application volume group for Oracle
item.description: Application volume group for Oracle is designed to greatly simplify the deployment of Azure NetApp Files volumes required to install and operate Oracle databases on Azure virtual machines at enterprise scale, with optimal performance and according to best practices.
item.atom:content: Application volume group for Oracle is designed to greatly simplify the deployment of Azure NetApp Files volumes required to install and operate Oracle databases on Azure virtual machines at enterprise scale, with optimal performance and according to best practices.

item.title: Monitor effectively using Azure Monitor for Azure Site Recovery
item.description: Azure Site Recovery (ASR) now surfaces default alerts via Azure Monitor for critical events such as replication health turning unhealthy, failover failures, agent expiry, and so on. You can monitor these alerts via the Azure Business Continuity Center, Azure Monitor dashboard, or your Recovery Services vault and route these alerts to various notification channels of choice (Email, ITSM, Webhook, SMS).
item.atom:content: Azure Site Recovery (ASR) now surfaces default alerts via Azure Monitor for critical events such as replication health turning unhealthy, failover failures, agent expiry, and so on. You can monitor these alerts via the Azure Business Continuity Center, Azure Monitor dashboard, or your Recovery Services vault and route these alerts to various notification channels of choice (Email, ITSM, Webhook, SMS).

item.title: Preview: Introducing Reporting Capabilities for Azure Site Recovery
item.description: Azure Site Recovery is introducing reporting capabilities to enable your BCDR Admin get rich insights into your estate protected with Site Recovery for audit and tracking purposes. These reports are highly customizable and are available out of box on Business Continuity Center, Recovery Service Vault and Backup Center. These reports provide historical evidence on failover jobs and replicated items.
item.atom:content: Azure Site Recovery is introducing reporting capabilities to enable your BCDR Admin get rich insights into your estate protected with Site Recovery for audit and tracking purposes. These reports are highly customizable and are available out of box on Business Continuity Center, Recovery Service Vault and Backup Center. These reports provide historical evidence on failover jobs and replicated items.

item.title: Announcing General Availability of Graph Semantics in Kusto
item.description: The Graph Semantics extension to Kusto is now generally available. Users are encouraged to integrate this tool into their production workflows to enhance understanding of complex datasets and uncover hidden patterns.
item.atom:content: The Graph Semantics extension to Kusto is now generally available. Users are encouraged to integrate this tool into their production workflows to enhance understanding of complex datasets and uncover hidden patterns.

item.title: Azure Firewall: New Regions Availability
item.description: Azure Firewall Basic, Standard, Premium and Azure Firewall Manager are now generally available in four new regions.
item.atom:content: Azure Firewall Basic, Standard, Premium and Azure Firewall Manager are now generally available in four new regions.

item.title: Public preview of the App Configuration Extension for AKS
item.description: Azure App Configuration extension for Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) allows you to install and manage Azure App Configuration Kubernetes Provider on your AKS cluster via Azure Resource Manager (ARM).
item.atom:content: Azure App Configuration extension for Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) allows you to install and manage Azure App Configuration Kubernetes Provider on your AKS cluster via Azure Resource Manager (ARM).

item.title: Azure portal now offers in context observability for AKS object overviews
item.description: View your key performance metrics for your AKS resources in context with the Azure Portal
item.atom:content: View your key performance metrics for your AKS resources in context with the Azure Portal

item.title: Public preview: Managed Prometheus visualizations for Azure Monitor container insights
item.description: Container insights now supports out of the box visualizations using only managed Prometheus.
item.atom:content: Container insights now supports out of the box visualizations using only managed Prometheus.

item.title: Preview: Windows gRPC support is now available on App Service
item.description: gRPC support for App Service Windows now in preview
item.atom:content: gRPC support for App Service Windows now in preview

item.title: Public preview: Azure Log Analytics enhances resilience with workspace replication across regions
item.description: Azure Log Analytics is announcing Workspace Replication, a new capability that enhances workspace resilience by enabling you to switch your workspace operation to another region if your primary region isn’t healthy.
item.atom:content: Azure Log Analytics is announcing Workspace Replication, a new capability that enhances workspace resilience by enabling you to switch your workspace operation to another region if your primary region isn’t healthy.

item.title: Expanding extensibility model to Pulumi in Azure Deployment Environments
item.description: Expanding extensibility model to Pulumi in Azure Deployment Environments
item.atom:content: Expanding extensibility model to Pulumi in Azure Deployment Environments

item.title: Public preview: Azure Firewall integration in Microsoft Copilot for Security
item.description: The Azure Firewall integration helps analysts perform detailed investigations of the malicious traffic intercepted by the IDPS feature of their firewalls across their entire fleet using natural language questions in the Copilot for Security standalone experience.
item.atom:content: The Azure Firewall integration helps analysts perform detailed investigations of the malicious traffic intercepted by the IDPS feature of their firewalls across their entire fleet using natural language questions in the Copilot for Security standalone experience.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) integration in Microsoft Copilot for Security
item.description: Increase your security posture and receive an analysis of the top Azure WAF rules triggered, top offending IPs in the environment, SQL injection and Cross-site scripting attacks blocked by WAF, along with natural language explanation of the analysis.
item.atom:content: Increase your security posture and receive an analysis of the top Azure WAF rules triggered, top offending IPs in the environment, SQL injection and Cross-site scripting attacks blocked by WAF, along with natural language explanation of the analysis.

item.title: Public preview: Aspire dashboard support in Azure Container Apps
item.description: You can now access the Aspire dashboard in Azure Portal for your Azure Container Apps project.
item.atom:content: You can now access the Aspire dashboard in Azure Portal for your Azure Container Apps project.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Functions support for HTTP streams in Python
item.description: Use HTTP streams in Python for processing large data streaming OpenAI responses and delivering dynamic content
item.atom:content: Use HTTP streams in Python for processing large data streaming OpenAI responses and delivering dynamic content

item.title: Azure Static Web Apps offers new Dedicated plan in preview
item.description: Enterprise-grade features for advanced use cases
item.atom:content: Enterprise-grade features for advanced use cases

item.title: New Azure Event Grid capabilities support IoT solutions, event sources
item.description: Additional support for Azure Event Hubs means customers can run existing Kafka workloads
item.atom:content: Additional support for Azure Event Hubs means customers can run existing Kafka workloads

item.title: Microsoft Dev Box introduces new ready-to-code and enterprise management capabilities
item.description: Dev Box has been updated with several new developer productivity and enterprise management capabilities.
item.atom:content: Dev Box has been updated with several new developer productivity and enterprise management capabilities.

item.title: Public Preview - Azure Compute Fleet
item.description: Azure Compute Fleet is a game changer in scaling and optimizing Azure compute resources across different virtual machine (VM) types, availability zones, and pricing models to achieve desired scale, performance, and cost.
item.atom:content: Azure Compute Fleet is a game changer in scaling and optimizing Azure compute resources across different virtual machine (VM) types, availability zones, and pricing models to achieve desired scale, performance, and cost.

item.title: Public Preview Azure OpenAI Semantic Caching policy in Azure API Management
item.description: We're excited to announce the Public Preview for the Azure OpenAI Semantic Caching policy in Azure API Management! This innovative feature empowers customers to optimize token usage by leveraging semantic caching, which intelligently stores completions for prompts with similar meanings.
item.atom:content: We're excited to announce the Public Preview for the Azure OpenAI Semantic Caching policy in Azure API Management! This innovative feature empowers customers to optimize token usage by leveraging semantic caching, which intelligently stores completions for prompts with similar meanings.

item.title: GA Circuit Breaker in Azure API Management
item.description: The circuit breaker, now generally available in Azure API Management, is seamlessly integrated to provide customers with an easy-to-use solution for enhancing the resilience of their API environments.
item.atom:content: The circuit breaker, now generally available in Azure API Management, is seamlessly integrated to provide customers with an easy-to-use solution for enhancing the resilience of their API environments.

item.title: GA OData API type in Azure API Management
item.description: We're thrilled to announce the general availability of the OData API type in Azure API Management. This exciting addition extends Azure API Management's capabilities to include OData APIs, allowing users to apply standard API protections such as authentication, authorization, and rate limiting, alongside OData-specific policies for request validation.
item.atom:content: We're thrilled to announce the general availability of the OData API type in Azure API Management. This exciting addition extends Azure API Management's capabilities to include OData APIs, allowing users to apply standard API protections such as authentication, authorization, and rate limiting, alongside OData-specific policies for request validation.

item.title: GA Load Balancer in Azure API Management
item.description: The General Availability of the Load Balancer feature in Azure API Management is here! Now, customers can effortlessly create a pool of backends and efficiently distribute the load across multiple endpoints. By establishing backend pools, users can seamlessly balance the load across various backends when integrating multiple backends for an API.
item.atom:content: The General Availability of the Load Balancer feature in Azure API Management is here! Now, customers can effortlessly create a pool of backends and efficiently distribute the load across multiple endpoints. By establishing backend pools, users can seamlessly balance the load across various backends when integrating multiple backends for an API.

item.title: GA Support for gRPC APIs in Azure API Management Self-hosted Gateway
item.description: We're thrilled to announce the general availability of gRPC support in Azure API Management through the self-hosted gateway. This exciting feature empowers customers to seamlessly manage their gRPC services as APIs within Azure API Management.
item.atom:content: We're thrilled to announce the general availability of gRPC support in Azure API Management through the self-hosted gateway. This exciting feature empowers customers to seamlessly manage their gRPC services as APIs within Azure API Management.

item.title: GA Azure OpenAI Emit Token Metric policy in Azure API Management
item.description: We're thrilled to announce the General Availability of the Azure OpenAI Emit Token Metric policy in Azure API Management! This new feature enables customers to effortlessly configure token usage metrics to be sent directly to Azure Application Insights, providing insights into the utilization of Azure OpenAI models across various applications and teams.
item.atom:content: We're thrilled to announce the General Availability of the Azure OpenAI Emit Token Metric policy in Azure API Management! This new feature enables customers to effortlessly configure token usage metrics to be sent directly to Azure Application Insights, providing insights into the utilization of Azure OpenAI models across various applications and teams.

item.title: GA Import Azure OpenAI enpoints as an APIs in Azure API Management
item.description: We're excited to announce the General Availability of the Import Azure OpenAI as an API feature in Azure API Management! With this new capability, customers can seamlessly import Azure OpenAI endpoints as an API with just a single click, streamlining the entire process.
item.atom:content: We're excited to announce the General Availability of the Import Azure OpenAI as an API feature in Azure API Management! With this new capability, customers can seamlessly import Azure OpenAI endpoints as an API with just a single click, streamlining the entire process.

item.title: GA Azure OpenAI Token Limit Policy in Azure API Management
item.description: We're excited to announce the General Availability of the Azure OpenAI Token Limit Policy in Azure API Management! This feature empowers customers to effectively manage and enforce limits on API consumers based on their usage of OpenAI tokens.
item.atom:content: We're excited to announce the General Availability of the Azure OpenAI Token Limit Policy in Azure API Management! This feature empowers customers to effectively manage and enforce limits on API consumers based on their usage of OpenAI tokens.

item.title: GA Improved Onboarding Experience on VS Code for Azure Logic Apps Standard
item.description: We're thrilled to announce the General Availability of the improved onboarding experience for the Logic Apps standard VS Code extension. This enhancement aims to streamline the process of transitioning from developing workflows in the cloud to a local environment, making it easier for developers to get started with Logic Apps development.
item.atom:content: We're thrilled to announce the General Availability of the improved onboarding experience for the Logic Apps standard VS Code extension. This enhancement aims to streamline the process of transitioning from developing workflows in the cloud to a local environment, making it easier for developers to get started with Logic Apps development.

item.title: Public Preview Azure Logic Apps Standard] .NET 8 Custom Code Support
item.description: We’ve extended our built-in action capabilities to include support for calling .NET 8 custom code, now available in public preview.
item.atom:content: We’ve extended our built-in action capabilities to include support for calling .NET 8 custom code, now available in public preview.

item.title: Public Preview Azure Logic Apps Standard Support for Zero Downtime deployment scenarios
item.description: We're excited to introduce support for Zero Downtime Deployment scenarios in Azure Logic Apps Standard, now available in Public Preview. This feature addresses one of the primary challenges in developing and maintaining mission-critical applications: ensuring continuous availability and responsiveness, even during updates or maintenance activities.
item.atom:content: We're excited to introduce support for Zero Downtime Deployment scenarios in Azure Logic Apps Standard, now available in Public Preview. This feature addresses one of the primary challenges in developing and maintaining mission-critical applications: ensuring continuous availability and responsiveness, even during updates or maintenance activities.

item.title: Public Preview Azure Logic Apps Standard Deployment Scripting Tools in VS Code
item.description: We're excited to introduce the Logic Apps Standard Deployment Scripting Tools in Visual Studio Code, now available in Public Preview. With this enhancement, users can streamline the development, testing, and storage of Standard logic app workflows running in single-tenant Azure Logic Apps directly within VS Code, using any source control system.
item.atom:content: We're excited to introduce the Logic Apps Standard Deployment Scripting Tools in Visual Studio Code, now available in Public Preview. With this enhancement, users can streamline the development, testing, and storage of Standard logic app workflows running in single-tenant Azure Logic Apps directly within VS Code, using any source control system.

item.title: Public Preview Azure Logic Apps Monitoring Dashboard for Workflow Monitoring, Troubleshooting, and Resubmissions
item.description: We're excited to announce the Public Preview release of UI dashboards for Logic Apps Standard, designed to enhance the monitoring, diagnosis, and troubleshooting of Logic Apps workflow runs and failures. This dashboard provides users with valuable insights into the health and performance of their workflows, empowering them to quickly identify and address any issues that may arise.
item.atom:content: We're excited to announce the Public Preview release of UI dashboards for Logic Apps Standard, designed to enhance the monitoring, diagnosis, and troubleshooting of Logic Apps workflow runs and failures. This dashboard provides users with valuable insights into the health and performance of their workflows, empowering them to quickly identify and address any issues that may arise.

item.title: GA EDI capabilities in Azure Logic Apps Standard
item.description: We're thrilled to announce the General Availability of EDI capabilities in Azure Logic Apps Standard, featuring built-in operations for processing B2B workloads at scale. With this release, customers can leverage native connectors to handle both single and batched EDI messages efficiently, including larger payloads.
item.atom:content: We're thrilled to announce the General Availability of EDI capabilities in Azure Logic Apps Standard, featuring built-in operations for processing B2B workloads at scale. With this release, customers can leverage native connectors to handle both single and batched EDI messages efficiently, including larger payloads.

item.title: Public Preview Azure Service Bus Enhancements
item.description: Azure Service Bus is a fully managed enterprise message broker that ensures secure and efficient delivery of data messages between different parts of your system, even when they're disconnected or processing tasks at different speeds. We're thrilled to announce a new feature to streamline message management and improve operational efficiency: batch delete.
item.atom:content: Azure Service Bus is a fully managed enterprise message broker that ensures secure and efficient delivery of data messages between different parts of your system, even when they're disconnected or processing tasks at different speeds. We're thrilled to announce a new feature to streamline message management and improve operational efficiency: batch delete.

item.title: Public Preview Azure Integration Account Enhancements
item.description: We're excited to introduce enhancements to the Azure Integration Account in Public Preview, aimed at providing users with increased flexibility, resilience, and security in managing their integration artifacts.
item.atom:content: We're excited to introduce enhancements to the Azure Integration Account in Public Preview, aimed at providing users with increased flexibility, resilience, and security in managing their integration artifacts.

item.title: Public preview: Dynamic sessions in Azure Container Apps
item.description: You can now now have easy access to fast, ephemeral, sandboxed compute on Azure without managing infrastructure.
item.atom:content: You can now now have easy access to fast, ephemeral, sandboxed compute on Azure without managing infrastructure.

item.title: Public Preview: Next-Gen Dashboards Experience in Azure Portal
item.description: We're adding a new Dashboards experience within the Azure Portal. You can use this feature in parallel to the current experience and it can be found in the Dashboard Hub and the Mobile App
item.atom:content: We're adding a new Dashboards experience within the Azure Portal. You can use this feature in parallel to the current experience and it can be found in the Dashboard Hub and the Mobile App

item.title: Public Preview: Set Java log levels in Azure Container Apps
item.description: Java application log levels can now be set dynamically in Azure Container Apps.
item.atom:content: Java application log levels can now be set dynamically in Azure Container Apps.

item.title: Public Preview: Monitor apps with Java metrics in Azure Container Apps
item.description: Use Azure Monitor to see Java metrics in Azure Container Apps and take advantage of all the Azure Monitor features.
item.atom:content: Use Azure Monitor to see Java metrics in Azure Container Apps and take advantage of all the Azure Monitor features.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Functions Support for HTTP Streams in Node.js
item.description: You can now stream HTTP requests to, and responses from, your Functions Apps.
item.atom:content: You can now stream HTTP requests to, and responses from, your Functions Apps.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Functions extension for Dapr
item.description: You can now use Dapr’s powerful cloud native building block API with Azure Functions.
item.atom:content: You can now use Dapr’s powerful cloud native building block API with Azure Functions.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Functions brings new flexibility with Azure Functions Flex Consumption
item.description: Flex consumption is a new Azure Functions hosting plan that provides fast scaling and networking features with a serverless billing model.
item.atom:content: Flex consumption is a new Azure Functions hosting plan that provides fast scaling and networking features with a serverless billing model.

item.title: Public preview: Get started with Azure Functions using Visual Studio Code for the Web
item.description: You can now use a fully browser based end-to-end development environment for Azure Functions, starting from the Azure Portal.
item.atom:content: You can now use a fully browser based end-to-end development environment for Azure Functions, starting from the Azure Portal.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Functions extension for OpenAI
item.description: The Azure Functions extension for OpenAI enables you to build intelligent applications with OpenAI.
item.atom:content: The Azure Functions extension for OpenAI enables you to build intelligent applications with OpenAI.

item.title: Public preview: SDK type bindings for Azure Blog Storage with Azure Functions in Python
item.description: SDK type bindings for Azure Blob Storage with Azure Functions in Python allow you to easily integrate event and data sources with function applications.
item.atom:content: SDK type bindings for Azure Blob Storage with Azure Functions in Python allow you to easily integrate event and data sources with function applications.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Functions can now run on Azure Container Apps
item.description: You can now quickly build event driven, cloud native apps, with the flexibility to run functions along with other microservices, APIs, websites, workflows or any container hosted programs.
item.atom:content: You can now quickly build event driven, cloud native apps, with the flexibility to run functions along with other microservices, APIs, websites, workflows or any container hosted programs.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Kubernetes Fleet Manager workload orchestration
item.description: You can now set taints and tolerations and rollout upgrades to only available resources.
item.atom:content: You can now set taints and tolerations and rollout upgrades to only available resources.

item.title: Generally Available: KEDA in the Azure Portal
item.description: You can now easily create and monitor your scaled objects all within the Portal interface.
item.atom:content: You can now easily create and monitor your scaled objects all within the Portal interface.

item.title: Public preview: Kubernetes version 1.30 support in AKS
item.description: You can now benefit from the latest enhancements available in Kubernetes 1.30 when using AKS.
item.atom:content: You can now benefit from the latest enhancements available in Kubernetes 1.30 when using AKS.

item.title: Draft now supports best practices via deployment safeguards
item.description: You can now scan your manifests to ensure you are following best practices.
item.atom:content: You can now scan your manifests to ensure you are following best practices.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Kubernetes Fleet Manager support for property-based scheduling and override
item.description: You can now customize cluster-specific resources and schedule workloads to clusters based on new heuristics.
item.atom:content: You can now customize cluster-specific resources and schedule workloads to clusters based on new heuristics.

item.title: Public preview: Deployment safeguards mutations in enforcement mode for AKS
item.description: Deployment safeguards in AKS can now adjust your deployment resources by applying best practices.
item.atom:content: Deployment safeguards in AKS can now adjust your deployment resources by applying best practices.

item.title: Generally Available: Automated deployments for AKS
item.description: Automated deployments for AKS simplifies the process of setting up the authorization of a workflow to a repository, generation of a starter application, and more.
item.atom:content: Automated deployments for AKS simplifies the process of setting up the authorization of a workflow to a repository, generation of a starter application, and more.

item.title: Public preview: AKS Automatic
item.description: AKS Automatic clusters are optimized to run most production workloads and provision compute resources based on Kubernetes manifests. The streamlined configuration follows AKS best practices and recommendations for cluster and workload setup, scalability, and security.
item.atom:content: AKS Automatic clusters are optimized to run most production workloads and provision compute resources based on Kubernetes manifests. The streamlined configuration follows AKS best practices and recommendations for cluster and workload setup, scalability, and security.

item.atom:content: You can now leverage storage support up to 32TB on the Business Critical service tier.

item.title: Public Preview: Microsoft Copilot now offers supportability in Azure Database for MySQL

item.atom:content: Microsoft Copilot in Azure extends capabilities to Azure Database for MySQL.

item.title: Generally Available: Accelerated logs in Azure Database for MySQL - Flexible Server

item.atom:content: Gain a performance boost in the Business Critical service tier of Azure Database for MySQL - Flexible Server with accelerated logs.

item.atom:content: General availability enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in late-May 2024.

item.title: Public Preview - On-demand backup and Export in Azure Database for MySQL - Flexible Server
item.description: This feature provides an ability to export at-moment physical backup of the server to Azure storage account (Azure Blob Storage).
item.atom:content: This feature provides an ability to export at-moment physical backup of the server to Azure storage account (Azure Blob Storage).

item.atom:content: Create text embeddings with sub 10ms latency from an LLM deployed within your Azure Database for PostgreSQL instance.

item.atom:content: Optimize your workload by creating suggested indexes and dropping duplicated or unused indexes.

item.title: Public preview: Change from serverless to provisioned capacity mode
item.description: Easily change the capacity mode of an Azure Cosmos DB account from serverless to provisioned capacity using Azure portal or Azure CLI without any hassle.
item.atom:content: Easily change the capacity mode of an Azure Cosmos DB account from serverless to provisioned capacity using Azure portal or Azure CLI without any hassle.

item.atom:content: The Azure AI extension allows customers to leverage large language models and build rich PostgreSQL GenAI applications.

item.title: General Availability: Azure Cosmos DB Vercel integration

item.atom:content: We're excited to announce Azure Cosmos DB integration with Vercel Generally Available.

item.title: Public Preview: DiskANN vector indexing and search in Azure Cosmos DB NoSQL
item.description: Azure Cosmos DB for NoSQL built-in vector search powered by DiskANN is in public preview.
item.atom:content: Azure Cosmos DB for NoSQL built-in vector search powered by DiskANN is in public preview.

item.title: General availability: Azure Cosmos DB Go SDK
item.description: The Azure Cosmos DB Go SDK is now available with improved support for global distribution.
item.atom:content: The Azure Cosmos DB Go SDK is now available with improved support for global distribution.

item.description: Cross region DR allows you to switch to another region in case of an outage.
item.atom:content: Cross region DR allows you to switch to another region in case of an outage.

item.atom:content: Implement your RAG pipelines with Azure Cosmos DB and LangChain and Semantic Kernel!

item.title: Public preview: Azure Cache for Redis Enterprise now offers a 1GB E1 SKU

item.atom:content: Azure Cache for Redis Enterprise will offer yet another smaller 1GB SKU for your vector search and semantic caching needs levering the powerful capabilities of RediSearch module.

item.atom:content: Trigger serverless functions through Azure Cache for Redis.

item.description: Computed properties make it easy to write NoSQL query logic once and reference it many times!
item.atom:content: Computed properties make it easy to write NoSQL query logic once and reference it many times!

item.title: Experimentation capabilities for Azure App Configuration now in public preview
item.description: Enables online experimentation for web, mobile, and Generative AI apps
item.atom:content: Enables online experimentation for web, mobile, and Generative AI apps

item.title: General availability: Azure Cache for Redis now supports Microsoft Entra ID authentication and authorization
item.description: Azure Cache for Redis now offers a password-free authentication mechanism by integrating with Microsoft Entra. This integration is complemented with the role-based access control that open source Redis supports.
item.atom:content: Azure Cache for Redis now offers a password-free authentication mechanism by integrating with Microsoft Entra. This integration is complemented with the role-based access control that open source Redis supports.

item.title: Azure Machine Learning - General Availability for Build 2024
item.description: One new feature now available in GA enables you to create and customize AI workflows using task-specific Language skills/models to complete business use cases.
item.atom:content: One new feature now available in GA enables you to create and customize AI workflows using task-specific Language skills/models to complete business use cases.

item.title: Preview: Azure Cobalt 100 Arm-based Virtual Machines
item.description: Azure Cobalt 100 Arm-based VMs are now available in preview. Please use the sign-up form at https://aka.ms/Cobalt100-VM-Preview-Signup to request access.
item.atom:content: Azure Cobalt 100 Arm-based VMs are now available in preview. Please use the sign-up form at https://aka.ms/Cobalt100-VM-Preview-Signup to request access.

item.title: Azure Machine Learning - Public Preview for Build 2024
item.description: Three features now available in preview enable you to enjoy simplified management of the customer-managed key (CMK) encrypted workspace, take advantage of our content filtering system alongside models that you can access through Models as a Service, and bring in indexes from Cosmos DB for MongoDB vCore and Pinecone for use in RAG workflows.
item.atom:content: Three features now available in preview enable you to enjoy simplified management of the customer-managed key (CMK) encrypted workspace, take advantage of our content filtering system alongside models that you can access through Models as a Service, and bring in indexes from Cosmos DB for MongoDB vCore and Pinecone for use in RAG workflows.

item.title: Update on Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Pricing
item.description: Azure will not charge for the data transfer across availability zones to help customers build more resilient and efficient applications on the cloud by leveraging availability zones. This will enable customers to leverage the benefits of zonal and zone-redundant services without extra costs for data transfer between availability zones.
item.atom:content: Azure will not charge for the data transfer across availability zones to help customers build more resilient and efficient applications on the cloud by leveraging availability zones. This will enable customers to leverage the benefits of zonal and zone-redundant services without extra costs for data transfer between availability zones.

item.title: Public Preview: Migrate virtual machine backups using standard backup policy to enhanced backup policy
item.description: Azure Backup now supports migrating virtual backups using standard backup policy to enhanced backup policy.
item.atom:content: Azure Backup now supports migrating virtual backups using standard backup policy to enhanced backup policy.

item.title: App Service Environment version 1 and version 2 will be retired on 31 August 2024
item.description: Migrate to App Service Environment v3 by 31 August 2024.
item.atom:content: Migrate to App Service Environment v3 by 31 August 2024.

item.title: Upcoming changes to Databricks materialized views and streaming tables in Databricks SQL
item.description: Azure Databricks materialized views and streaming tables Billing change
item.atom:content: Azure Databricks materialized views and streaming tables Billing change

item.title: General availability: ExpressRoute Seamless Gateway Migration
item.description: ExpressRoute customers can now deploy a second gateway to the Gateway Subnet. This will enable a seamless migration to an Az-enabled Gateway SKU and upgrade your Public IP configurations.
item.atom:content: ExpressRoute customers can now deploy a second gateway to the Gateway Subnet. This will enable a seamless migration to an Az-enabled Gateway SKU and upgrade your Public IP configurations.

item.title: The availability of Azure compute reservations will continue until further notice
item.description: Initially planned to end on January 1, 2024, the availability of Azure compute reservation exchanges for Azure Virtual Machine, Azure Dedicated Host and Azure App Service has been extended until further notice.
item.atom:content: Initially planned to end on January 1, 2024, the availability of Azure compute reservation exchanges for Azure Virtual Machine, Azure Dedicated Host and Azure App Service has been extended until further notice.

item.title: General Availability: Data API builder
item.description: Add a feature-rich data API to an Azure database or on-prem database using Microsoft's open-source Data API builder.
item.atom:content: Add a feature-rich data API to an Azure database or on-prem database using Microsoft's open-source Data API builder.

item.title: Public preview: Sensitive data protection for Azure Front Door Web Application Firewall
item.description: Protect the sensitive data getting stored in your Web Application Firewall (WAF) using log scrubbing on Azure’s global Web Application Firewall running on Azure Front Door.
item.atom:content: Protect the sensitive data getting stored in your Web Application Firewall (WAF) using log scrubbing on Azure’s global Web Application Firewall running on Azure Front Door.

item.title: Introducing GPT-4o: OpenAI’s new flagship multimodal model now in preview on Azure
item.description: Microsoft is thrilled to announce the launch of GPT-4o, OpenAI’s new flagship model, now available on Azure AI in preview. This groundbreaking multimodal model integrates text, vision, and audio capabilities, setting a new standard for generative and conversational AI experiences. GPT-4o is available now in Azure OpenAI Service, in preview, with support for text and image. Azure OpenAI Service customers can explore GPT-4o’s extensive capabilities through a preview playground in Azure OpenAI Studio starting today in two regions in the US. This initial release focuses on text and vision inputs to provide a glimpse into the model's potential, paving the way for further capabilities like audio.
item.atom:content: Microsoft is thrilled to announce the launch of GPT-4o, OpenAI’s new flagship model, now available on Azure AI in preview. This groundbreaking multimodal model integrates text, vision, and audio capabilities, setting a new standard for generative and conversational AI experiences. GPT-4o is available now in Azure OpenAI Service, in preview, with support for text and image. Azure OpenAI Service customers can explore GPT-4o’s extensive capabilities through a preview playground in Azure OpenAI Studio starting today in two regions in the US. This initial release focuses on text and vision inputs to provide a glimpse into the model's potential, paving the way for further capabilities like audio.

item.title: Azure Front Door server variable enhancement generally available
item.description: Azure Front Door supports capturing URL path and URL case transformation in rules set and server variable.
item.atom:content: Azure Front Door supports capturing URL path and URL case transformation in rules set and server variable.

item.atom:content: Ubuntu 24.04 LTS, the latest Ubuntu LTS release from Canonical, is now available for Azure Virtual Machines (VMs)

item.atom:content: Designed for customers, especially developers or small enterprises who are looking for a cost-effective Application Load Balancer solution and don’t require high scalability and the advanced features.

item.description: The Bastion Developer SKU represents a novel, cost-effective, and streamlined version of the Bastion service.
item.atom:content: The Bastion Developer SKU represents a novel, cost-effective, and streamlined version of the Bastion service.

item.title: Cloud Services (classic) deployment model is retiring on 31 August 2024
item.description: Cloud Services (classic) retiring in August 2024.
item.atom:content: Cloud Services (classic) retiring in August 2024.

item.title: Announcing the General Availability of GPT-4 Turbo with Vision on Azure OpenAI Service
item.description: We are thrilled to announce the general availability of GPT-4 Turbo with Vision on the Azure OpenAI Service, which processes both text and image inputs and replaces several preview models. This multimodal model has already been used by customers in various industries to enhance efficiencies and innovate, with case studies to be featured at the upcoming Build conference. For deployment details and future enhancements, including JSON mode and function calling for image inputs, please refer to our Azure OpenAI Service resources and updates.
item.atom:content: We are thrilled to announce the general availability of GPT-4 Turbo with Vision on the Azure OpenAI Service, which processes both text and image inputs and replaces several preview models. This multimodal model has already been used by customers in various industries to enhance efficiencies and innovate, with case studies to be featured at the upcoming Build conference. For deployment details and future enhancements, including JSON mode and function calling for image inputs, please refer to our Azure OpenAI Service resources and updates.

item.atom:content: You can now take advantage of new enhancements available in version 1.4.3

item.atom:content: You can now use node initialization taints in AKS e.g. in scenarios where you may need extra time to setup your nodes.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Storage Actions is now available in 14 more regions

item.atom:content: Azure Storage Actions is a fully managed platform that helps you automate data management operations for object storage and data lakes. The preview is now available in 14 more regions.

item.title: General Availability: Microsoft Azure now available from new cloud region in Mexico

item.atom:content: Microsoft has announced the opening of its first hyper-scale cloud region in Mexico.

item.title: Azure Front Door log scrubbing of sensitive data is generally available

item.atom:content: Azure Front Door supports removing sensitive data from Azure Front Door access log.

item.title: General Availability - Azure API Center
item.description: Azure API Center is now generally available, providing a centralized solution to manage the challenges of API sprawl, which is exacerbated by the rapid proliferation of APIs and AI solutions. Azure API Center offers a unified inventory for seamless discovery, consumption, and governance of APIs, regardless of their type, lifecycle stage, or deployment location.
item.atom:content: Azure API Center is now generally available, providing a centralized solution to manage the challenges of API sprawl, which is exacerbated by the rapid proliferation of APIs and AI solutions. Azure API Center offers a unified inventory for seamless discovery, consumption, and governance of APIs, regardless of their type, lifecycle stage, or deployment location.

item.title: Action needed: Update Azure Autoscale Notifications to using additional email addresses for notifications
item.description: Azure Classic roles will be retired by 31st August, 2024 – transition to using only additional email addresses for Azure Autoscale Notifications as Azure Autoscale is dependent on the Azure Classic Roles.
item.atom:content: Azure Classic roles will be retired by 31st August, 2024 – transition to using only additional email addresses for Azure Autoscale Notifications as Azure Autoscale is dependent on the Azure Classic Roles.

item.title: Azure Governance Update - Management Groups
item.description: Beginning May 3, 2024, Azure will start enabling the root management group for tenants that have not enabled it yet. Using Azure management groups leverages best practices when applying Azure Policy and having it pre-enabled reduces the initial set up work to follow the best practices.
item.atom:content: Beginning May 3, 2024, Azure will start enabling the root management group for tenants that have not enabled it yet. Using Azure management groups leverages best practices when applying Azure Policy and having it pre-enabled reduces the initial set up work to follow the best practices.

item.title: Azure Virtual Network Manager user-defined route (UDR) management now in public preview
item.description: UDR management in Azure Virtual Network Manager is now in public preview, enabling users to describe their desired routing behavior via configuration, simplifying the management of routing behaviors at scale.
item.atom:content: UDR management in Azure Virtual Network Manager is now in public preview, enabling users to describe their desired routing behavior via configuration, simplifying the management of routing behaviors at scale.

item.title: Generally available: Azure IoT Edge v1.5.0 (LTS) release
item.description: The Azure IoT Edge release of v1.5 is the latest LTS version of Azure IoT Edge.
item.atom:content: The Azure IoT Edge release of v1.5 is the latest LTS version of Azure IoT Edge.

item.title: Azure Spring Apps Feature Update Q1 2024: Save up to 47% with Azure savings plan
item.description: Announcing the exciting feature updates for Azure Spring Apps in Q1 2024. Save up to 47% with Azure Savings plan.
item.atom:content: Announcing the exciting feature updates for Azure Spring Apps in Q1 2024. Save up to 47% with Azure Savings plan.

item.title: General availability: Mexico Central region added to Azure HDInsight
item.description: HDInsight is now generally available in Mexico Central. Azure HDInsight is a managed, full-spectrum, open-source analytics service in the cloud for enterprises. You can use open-source frameworks such as Hadoop, Apache Spark, Apache Hive, LLAP, Apache Kafka, and more. For more information about HDInsight, see the Azure HDInsight documentation.
item.atom:content: HDInsight is now generally available in Mexico Central. Azure HDInsight is a managed, full-spectrum, open-source analytics service in the cloud for enterprises. You can use open-source frameworks such as Hadoop, Apache Spark, Apache Hive, LLAP, Apache Kafka, and more. For more information about HDInsight, see the Azure HDInsight documentation.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure HDInsight on AKS is now available for preview in 7 new regions
item.description: Azure HDInsight on AKS is now available for preview in seven new regions - East US 2 EUAP, West US, Japan East, Australia East, Canada Central, North Europe, Brazil South. Azure HDInsight on AKS is a modern, reliable, secure, and fully managed Platform as a Service (PaaS) that runs on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS). HDInsight on AKS allows you to deploy popular Open-Source Analytics workloads like Apache Spark™, Apache Flink®️, and Trino without the overhead of managing and monitoring containers. For more information about Azure HDInsight on AKS, see the documentation.
item.atom:content: Azure HDInsight on AKS is now available for preview in seven new regions - East US 2 EUAP, West US, Japan East, Australia East, Canada Central, North Europe, Brazil South. Azure HDInsight on AKS is a modern, reliable, secure, and fully managed Platform as a Service (PaaS) that runs on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS). HDInsight on AKS allows you to deploy popular Open-Source Analytics workloads like Apache Spark™, Apache Flink®️, and Trino without the overhead of managing and monitoring containers. For more information about Azure HDInsight on AKS, see the documentation.

item.atom:content: Azure Chaos Studio is now supporting resource tags.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Monitor pipeline (at edge)
item.description: We are announcing public preview Azure Monitor pipeline (for edge). With this, we are now extending our Azure Monitor pipeline capabilities from the cloud to the edge, enabling seamless and high-scale data ingestion with centralized configuration management.
item.atom:content: We are announcing public preview Azure Monitor pipeline (for edge). With this, we are now extending our Azure Monitor pipeline capabilities from the cloud to the edge, enabling seamless and high-scale data ingestion with centralized configuration management.

item.atom:content: Viewing changes to your Azure resources just became easier! With Azure Resource Graph’s Change Analysis, you can now view all your resource changes across all your tenants and subscriptions in the Azure Portal.

item.title: Public Preview – DR for Shared Disks – Azure Site Recovery
item.description: Now you can use the benefits of Shared Disk for your mission-critical applications such as SQL FCI, SAP ASCS, Scale-out File Servers, etc., while ensuring business continuity and disaster recovery with Azure Site Recovery.
item.atom:content: Now you can use the benefits of Shared Disk for your mission-critical applications such as SQL FCI, SAP ASCS, Scale-out File Servers, etc., while ensuring business continuity and disaster recovery with Azure Site Recovery.

item.title: Azure Data Box Disk is now available with hardware encryption
item.description: Azure Data Box Disk is now Generally Available with hardware encryption.
item.atom:content: Azure Data Box Disk is now Generally Available with hardware encryption.

item.title: General availability: HBv4-series & HX-series VMs are now available in Sweden Central.
item.description: HBv4 virtual machines (VMs) are optimized for various HPC workloads such as computational fluid dynamics, finite element analysis, frontend and backend EDA, rendering, molecular dynamics, computational geoscience, weather simulation, and financial risk analysis. HX-series Virtual Machines (VMs) are optimized for large memory HPC workloads such as backend EDA, finite element analysis, computational geoscience, and big data analytics.
item.atom:content: HBv4 virtual machines (VMs) are optimized for various HPC workloads such as computational fluid dynamics, finite element analysis, frontend and backend EDA, rendering, molecular dynamics, computational geoscience, weather simulation, and financial risk analysis. HX-series Virtual Machines (VMs) are optimized for large memory HPC workloads such as backend EDA, finite element analysis, computational geoscience, and big data analytics.

item.title: Azure Machine Learning data collector is now generally available
item.description: Azure Machine Learning data collector provides real-time logging of input and output data from models that are deployed to managed online endpoints or Kubernetes online endpoints. This data can be seamlessly used for model monitoring, debugging, or auditing, thereby providing observability into the performance of your deployed models.
item.atom:content: Azure Machine Learning data collector provides real-time logging of input and output data from models that are deployed to managed online endpoints or Kubernetes online endpoints. This data can be seamlessly used for model monitoring, debugging, or auditing, thereby providing observability into the performance of your deployed models.

item.title: GA: Azure Monitor log search alerts support managed identities
item.description: A common challenge for developers is the management of credentials for applications to use when connecting to resources. Managed identities provide an automatically managed identity in Microsoft Entra ID. Applications can use managed identities to obtain Microsoft Entra tokens without having to manage any credentials.
item.atom:content: A common challenge for developers is the management of credentials for applications to use when connecting to resources. Managed identities provide an automatically managed identity in Microsoft Entra ID. Applications can use managed identities to obtain Microsoft Entra tokens without having to manage any credentials.

item.title: Using Azure Virtual Network Manager network groups in security admin rules is now in public preview
item.description: Using your Azure Virtual Network Manager network groups in the source and/or destination of security admin rules is now in public preview, enabling users to achieve network isolation across different environments and manage network segments more easily at scale.
item.atom:content: Using your Azure Virtual Network Manager network groups in the source and/or destination of security admin rules is now in public preview, enabling users to achieve network isolation across different environments and manage network segments more easily at scale.

item.title: Action recommended: Prepare for model version retirement in Azure OpenAI
item.description: Action recommended: Prepare for model version retirement in Azure OpenAI
item.atom:content: Action recommended: Prepare for model version retirement in Azure OpenAI

item.title: Azure Machine Learning - General Availability for April 2024
item.description: Three features now available in GA enable you to seamlessly log inference data to a central location, set up event-driven applications, processes, or workflows based on Azure Machine Learning events, and utilize lifecycle management of features from creation through archival.
item.atom:content: Three features now available in GA enable you to seamlessly log inference data to a central location, set up event-driven applications, processes, or workflows based on Azure Machine Learning events, and utilize lifecycle management of features from creation through archival.

item.title: General availability: Azure Virtual Network encryption availability in all regions
item.description: Azure Virtual Network encryption is a feature of Azure Virtual Networks. Virtual network encryption allows you to seamlessly encrypt and decrypt traffic between Azure Virtual Machines.
item.atom:content: Azure Virtual Network encryption is a feature of Azure Virtual Networks. Virtual network encryption allows you to seamlessly encrypt and decrypt traffic between Azure Virtual Machines.

item.title: Announcing Public Preview of Query editor in Azure Monitor Metrics
item.description: Public Preview of Query editor in Azure Monitor Metrics is now Available! Get started with Query editor to access advanced querying capabilities within Azure Monitor Metrics. With the Query Editor's seamless integration of the widely adopted Prometheus Query Language (PromQL), customers can unlock advanced querying capabilities within their Azure Monitor Workspace. With PromQL, you can now efficiently analyze Prometheus metrics, identify trends, troubleshoot issues, and optimize resource utilization for better performance and reliability.
item.atom:content: Public Preview of Query editor in Azure Monitor Metrics is now Available! Get started with Query editor to access advanced querying capabilities within Azure Monitor Metrics. With the Query Editor's seamless integration of the widely adopted Prometheus Query Language (PromQL), customers can unlock advanced querying capabilities within their Azure Monitor Workspace. With PromQL, you can now efficiently analyze Prometheus metrics, identify trends, troubleshoot issues, and optimize resource utilization for better performance and reliability.

item.title: Generally available: Azure Site Recovery update rollup 73 - April 2024
item.description: This article describes the improvements for the latest version of Azure Site Recovery components.
item.atom:content: This article describes the improvements for the latest version of Azure Site Recovery components.

item.title: Azure Event Grid support for last will & testament (LWT) capabilities now in Public Preview
item.description: Ensures predictable and reliable flow of communication among MQTT clients during unexpected disconnections.
item.atom:content: Ensures predictable and reliable flow of communication among MQTT clients during unexpected disconnections.

item.title: GA: New Property for Disks-LastOwnershipUpdateTime
item.description: Introducing LastOwnershipUpdateTime for Disks in Azure Portal, PowerShell, and CLI. It indicates the last state change time for the Disk, useful for tracking its current state and when it was last updated.
item.atom:content: Introducing LastOwnershipUpdateTime for Disks in Azure Portal, PowerShell, and CLI. It indicates the last state change time for the Disk, useful for tracking its current state and when it was last updated.

item.title: General availability: Azure SQL updates for mid-April 2024
item.description: General availability enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in mid-April 2024.
item.atom:content: General availability enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in mid-April 2024.

item.title: Azure Red Hat OpenShift April 2024 updates
item.description: New features include support for ARO in Azure Terraform provider, ability to bring your own NSG, new GPU instance types for Day 2 operations, and more!
item.atom:content: New features include support for ARO in Azure Terraform provider, ability to bring your own NSG, new GPU instance types for Day 2 operations, and more!

item.title: General availability: Extensible key management using Azure Key Vault for SQL Server on Linux
item.description: Extensible key management (EKM) using Azure Key Vault in SQL Server on Linux is now generally available from SQL Server 2022 CU12 onwards.
item.atom:content: Extensible key management (EKM) using Azure Key Vault in SQL Server on Linux is now generally available from SQL Server 2022 CU12 onwards.

item.title: General Availability: Virtual private network (VPN) with Azure Managed Instance for Apache Cassandra
item.description: For enhanced security in your virtual network architectures where outbound connectivity is not allowed.
item.atom:content: For enhanced security in your virtual network architectures where outbound connectivity is not allowed.

item.title: General Availability: Azure Database for PostgreSQL - Flexible Server networking with Azure Private Link
item.description: Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server now supports Private Endpoints in General Availability.
item.atom:content: Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server now supports Private Endpoints in General Availability.

item.title: Public Preview: Long-term retention for Azure Database for MySQL – Flexible Server
item.description: The feature will allow you to retain/manage backups for up to 10 years in the standard tier according to your compliance and auditing needs.
item.atom:content: The feature will allow you to retain/manage backups for up to 10 years in the standard tier according to your compliance and auditing needs.

item.title: Generally available: Defender for Cloud supports Azure Database for MySQL - Flexible Server
item.description: You can now protect Azure Database for MySQL - Flexible Server with Microsoft Defender for Cloud.
item.atom:content: You can now protect Azure Database for MySQL - Flexible Server with Microsoft Defender for Cloud.

item.title: Public Preview: Mirroring Azure Cosmos DB in Microsoft Fabric
item.description: Get near-real time analytics on your Azure Cosmos DB data in Microsoft Fabric with zero-ETL.
item.atom:content: Get near-real time analytics on your Azure Cosmos DB data in Microsoft Fabric with zero-ETL.

item.title: Run Azure Load Testing on Azure App Service web apps
item.description: Load test your web apps directly from Azure App Service in Azure portal.
item.atom:content: Load test your web apps directly from Azure App Service in Azure portal.

item.title: Native Delta Lake Output Now Generally Available in Azure Stream Analytics
item.description: The native support for Delta Lake output in Azure Stream Analytics is now generally available.
item.atom:content: The native support for Delta Lake output in Azure Stream Analytics is now generally available.

item.title: Azure Load Testing availability in Fairfax (USGov Virginia)
item.description: Azure Load Testing GA in Fairfax cloud - USGov Virginia. US Government customers on the Fairfax cloud can now use Azure Load Testing to simplify their end-to-end load testing process.
item.atom:content: Azure Load Testing GA in Fairfax cloud - USGov Virginia. US Government customers on the Fairfax cloud can now use Azure Load Testing to simplify their end-to-end load testing process.

item.title: App Service virtual network integration multi plan subnet join
item.description: We're excited to announce that the multi plan subnet join for virtual network integration is now available in preview in all regions!
item.atom:content: We're excited to announce that the multi plan subnet join for virtual network integration is now available in preview in all regions!

item.title: General Available: Azure Synapse Runtime for Apache Spark 3.4 is now GA
item.description: Azure Synapse Runtime for Apache Spark 3.4 is now Generally Available
item.atom:content: Azure Synapse Runtime for Apache Spark 3.4 is now Generally Available

item.title: Public preview: Backup and restore of virtual machines with private endpoint enabled disks
item.description: Azure Backup can now help you back up virtual machines using private endpoint-enabled disks. You can now also specify network settings to be used by the restored disks while initiating the restore process.
item.atom:content: Azure Backup can now help you back up virtual machines using private endpoint-enabled disks. You can now also specify network settings to be used by the restored disks while initiating the restore process.

item.title: Azure Virtual Network Manager Security Admin Rule generally available in 45 regions
item.description: Azure Virtual Network Manager's security admin rule configuration is now generally available in 45 regions, empowering users to enforce security rules across their virtual networks globally.
item.atom:content: Azure Virtual Network Manager's security admin rule configuration is now generally available in 45 regions, empowering users to enforce security rules across their virtual networks globally.

item.title: General Availability of Azure Logic Apps connectors for IBM Mainframe and Midranges
item.description: Exciting news! Our IBM Mainframe and Midrange connectors, including IBM 3270, IBM CICS, IBM DB2, IBM i, IBM MQ, and IBM IMS, are now generally available. These connectors address highly sought-after customer requests, bring capabilities to extend Azure Logic Apps cloud native workloads with some of the oldest systems ever built for Mainframes and Midranges.
item.atom:content: Exciting news! Our IBM Mainframe and Midrange connectors, including IBM 3270, IBM CICS, IBM DB2, IBM i, IBM MQ, and IBM IMS, are now generally available. These connectors address highly sought-after customer requests, bring capabilities to extend Azure Logic Apps cloud native workloads with some of the oldest systems ever built for Mainframes and Midranges.

item.title: Public Preview of Azure OpenAI and AI Search in-app connectors for Logic Apps (Standard)
item.description: We're thrilled to announce two new built-in connectors for Azure Logic Apps: Azure OpenAI and Azure AI Search. With the increasing adoption of AI technologies, there's a growing demand to integrate these capabilities seamlessly into Logic Apps workflows. To address this need, we're launching the Public Preview of these connectors, bridging the gap between Logic Apps and AI.
item.atom:content: We're thrilled to announce two new built-in connectors for Azure Logic Apps: Azure OpenAI and Azure AI Search. With the increasing adoption of AI technologies, there's a growing demand to integrate these capabilities seamlessly into Logic Apps workflows. To address this need, we're launching the Public Preview of these connectors, bridging the gap between Logic Apps and AI.

item.title: Public Preview: Resiliency Review on Azure Advisor
item.description: Improve your workload’s resiliency and optimize your cloud deployments by reviewing recommendations on Advisor
item.atom:content: Improve your workload’s resiliency and optimize your cloud deployments by reviewing recommendations on Advisor

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Monitor introduces Prometheus community recommended alerts
item.description: Enable Prometheus community recommended alerts to monitor key signals to be promptly notified on potential critical issues within your clusters.
item.atom:content: Enable Prometheus community recommended alerts to monitor key signals to be promptly notified on potential critical issues within your clusters.

item.title: Generally Available: AKS cost views
item.description: The Kubernetes clusters and Kubernetes namespaces cost views are now generally available in Cost analysis within Azure portal. You can view the aggregated costs for all your AKS clusters and namespaces across a subscription and drill down into infrastructure and namespaces costs of a cluster.
item.atom:content: The Kubernetes clusters and Kubernetes namespaces cost views are now generally available in Cost analysis within Azure portal. You can view the aggregated costs for all your AKS clusters and namespaces across a subscription and drill down into infrastructure and namespaces costs of a cluster.

item.title: Announcing General Availability of Azure API Management Basic v2 and Standard v2 Tiers
item.description: We're thrilled to announce the General Availability of Azure API Management's newest pricing tiers – Basic v2 and Standard v2. The Azure API Management v2 pricing tiers represent a significant leap forward, offering a comprehensive range of capabilities tailored to projects of all sizes, from small-scale endeavors to large-scale enterprise applications. Importantly, these new v2 pricing tiers are available alongside our existing Azure API Management classic pricing tiers, ensuring continuity for users. It's worth noting that the Azure API Management classic pricing tiers remain actively supported and invested in.
item.atom:content: We're thrilled to announce the General Availability of Azure API Management's newest pricing tiers – Basic v2 and Standard v2. The Azure API Management v2 pricing tiers represent a significant leap forward, offering a comprehensive range of capabilities tailored to projects of all sizes, from small-scale endeavors to large-scale enterprise applications. Importantly, these new v2 pricing tiers are available alongside our existing Azure API Management classic pricing tiers, ensuring continuity for users. It's worth noting that the Azure API Management classic pricing tiers remain actively supported and invested in.

item.title: GA: Azure API Management Developer Portal Unveils Enhanced Features for Increased Developer Productivity
item.description: The API Management developer portal is an automatically generated, fully customizable website with the documentation of your APIs. It's where API consumers can discover your APIs, learn how to use them, request access, and try them out. We recently improved the portal editor interface to boost your productivity and enhance the interactions with your favorite features and tools.
item.atom:content: The API Management developer portal is an automatically generated, fully customizable website with the documentation of your APIs. It's where API consumers can discover your APIs, learn how to use them, request access, and try them out. We recently improved the portal editor interface to boost your productivity and enhance the interactions with your favorite features and tools.

item.title: Public preview: ExpressRoute Metro for High Resiliency
item.description: ExpressRoute lets you extend your on-premises networks into the Microsoft cloud over a private connection with the help of a connectivity provider. With ExpressRoute, you can establish connections to Microsoft cloud services, such as Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365.
item.atom:content: ExpressRoute lets you extend your on-premises networks into the Microsoft cloud over a private connection with the help of a connectivity provider. With ExpressRoute, you can establish connections to Microsoft cloud services, such as Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365.
